title: California wildfires continue as PG&E gets reprimanded
text:
As two major wildfires persist on opposite ends of California Saturday, Governor Gavin Newsom on Friday declared an emergency proclamation for the counties of Sonoma and Los Angeles due to the effects of the Kincade and Tick fires.

Newsom also had harsh words for bankrupt power producer PG&E, who switched off power to nearly 200,000 homes and businesses ahead of this week's earlier bout of severe winds in an effort to prevent downed power lines from sparking fires.

(SOUNDBITE) (ENGLISH) CALIFORNIA GOVERNOR GAVIN NEWSOM, SAYING:

“We should not have to be here...years and years of greed, years and years of mismanagement- particularly with the largest investor-owned utility in the state of California, P-G and E. That greed has precipitated in lack of intentionality in hardening their grid, undergrounding their transmission lines, they simply did not do their job.”

LA’s Tick fire has resulted in the displacement of 50,000 suburban Los Angeles residents, while the Kincade fire had charred nearly 22,000 acres in Sonoma County's famed wine country as of

Friday.

No human injuries have been reported from either fire.

Forecasts called for heavy winds to return late on Saturday and persist through the weekend, leaving fire crews a narrow window to tamp down the blazes in Los Angeles and Sonoma counties.
